instance_text.corrected: It is really good. It is better than the previous novel, FSOGrey. I really mean it. It is not porn. BE GROWN UP PLEASE. If you don't want to read the 'sex parts', just turn over the next page till it ends, that's all. I did that to finish that novel. This novel is just to tell us the passionate love story between a successful businessman, chairmen man with a very unhappy childhood, and he only refers to his birth mother as 'the crack whore', which is related to his recent behaviour - BDSM. feedback.feedback_explanation: "Recently" is an adverb, but it seems to be modifying "behaviour." An adjective should be used instead.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "recently" to its adjective form by removing the "-ly" suffix.

instance_text.source: I thought that writing an article on my favourite sport would be interesting for the readers. Above all, and making no differences of the sport you have chosen, it is paramount to do some sport, whatever sport you choose, such as spinning. That is my favourite sport.
instance_text.corrected: I thought that writing an article on my favourite sport would be interesting for the readers. Above all, and regardless of the sport you have chosen, it is paramount to do some sport, whatever sport you choose, such as spinning. That is my favourite sport.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Making no differences of" does not sound natural here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Try using another term such as "regardless of."

instance_text.source: Others problems cited included pretty low uptime of the website, connection issues and login problems, particularly correct credentials not working.
instance_text.corrected: Other problems cited included pretty low uptime of the website, connection issues and login problems, particularly correct credentials not working.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The determiner "other" does not become plural to match a plural noun.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "others" to "other."

instance_text.source: I'm a cheerful person, so I would attempt to give my best for keep the attention of the children.
instance_text.corrected: I'm a cheerful person, so I would attempt to give my best to keep the attention of the children.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You can't use "for keep" to express purpose. Purpose clauses typically use a phrase with a to-infinitive or a that clause.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "for" to "to" to change this into a to-infinitive.

instance_text.source: Apart from that, I imagine the world with everything automatic, planes that take me from New York to Dubai in three hours and robot instead of waiters in a restaurant.
instance_text.corrected: Apart from that, I imagine the world with everything automatic, planes that take me from New York to Dubai in three hours and robots instead of waiters in a restaurant.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Robot" is singular here, but you seem to be talking about more than one.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "robot" to be plural.

instance_text.source: My favourite kinds of movie are comedy and comedy drama because they has interesting plots and characters, someone and who watches comedy can laugh all the time.
instance_text.corrected: My favourite kinds of movie are comedy and comedy drama because they have interesting plots and characters, someone and who watches comedy can laugh all the time.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "they" is plural, but "has" can only be used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "has" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: Security against terrorist attacks was promised to be step up, but policemen are not seen in the streets and neither are security cameras.
instance_text.corrected: Security against terrorist attacks was promised to be stepped up, but policemen are not seen in the streets and neither are security cameras.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Be step up" seems to be in the passive voice here, but "step" has the wrong form. The passive can be made with the be verb + a past participle.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "step up" to the past participle to fix this passive.

instance_text.source: Parents' words is key to restricting their kids' actions.
instance_text.corrected: Parents' words are key to restricting their kids' actions.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Words" is plural, but "is" is only used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "is" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: Except for [NONE] the big cities, public transport is not an easy way to get around the city. That means that in the future even more people will stop using it.
instance_text.corrected: Except for in the big cities, public transport is not an easy way to get around the city. That means that in the future even more people will stop using it.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You need a prepositional phrase or adverb to express where something is true or where something happens.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "in" before "the big cities" to focus on how things are there.

instance_text.source: The moral is about students don't be naïve and being careful of unscrupulous men that sell drugs.
instance_text.corrected: The moral is about students not being naïve and being careful of unscrupulous men that sell drugs.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Don't be" is modifying "students," so it has to be in participle form.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "don't be" to "not" plus the -ing form to make it a participle.

instance_text.source: So, in summary, to save the environment, to make the roads accessible to everyone, public transport should have been used and we should all try to educate people about the importance of public transport.
instance_text.corrected: So, in summary, to save the environment, to make the roads accessible to everyone, public transport should be used and we should all try to educate people about the importance of public transport.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Should have been" is used to talk about the past, but it seems like this sentence is about how things should be now or in the future.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "should have been" to "should be" to talk about the present or future.

instance_text.source: In the past, people bought thing, and they didn't care how dangerous they were for the planet.
instance_text.corrected: In the past, people bought things, and they didn't care how dangerous they were for the planet.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Thing" is singular here, but you seem to be talking about more than one.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "thing" to be plural.

instance_text.source: In addition, we could play outdoor games and they may do landscape painting.
instance_text.corrected: In addition, we could play outdoor games and they could do landscape painting.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "May" can be used for possibility, but it is a little weak for this situation. Another modal may be better here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider changing "may" to "could."

instance_text.source: When Michael woke up that morning he smelled a strange smell in the air. He did not know what what the source of that strange smell was but, in his nose, he received a kind of sign something bad [NONE] happened.
instance_text.corrected: When Michael woke up that morning he smelled a strange smell in the air. He did not know what what the source of that strange smell was but, in his nose, he received a kind of sign something bad had happened.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When we talk about two past events, we use "had" before the verb of the earlier event. This is called the past perfect tense.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add "had" before "happened" to make it past perfect.

instance_text.source: I miss you so much. How are your baby?
instance_text.corrected: I miss you so much. How is your baby?

feedback.feedback_explanation: The subject, "your baby" is in the third person singular. The verb must be in a different form to match with it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "are" to a form that goes with a third-person singular subject.

instance_text.source: I do a lot of sports, for example, cycling, karting, football and basketball but my favourite sport is swimming because I have done this sport with my grandfather since 1995.
instance_text.corrected: I do a lot of sports, for example, cycling, karting, football and basketball but my favourite sport is swimming because I have been doing this sport with my grandfather since 1995.

instance_text.source: Maybe, in 2060, we will be able to go to the moon very easy, like going to Europe.
instance_text.corrected: Maybe, in 2060, we will be able to go to the moon very easily, like going to Europe.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "easy" is an adjective, but we need an adverb to modify a verb like "go."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "easy" to its adverb form, "easily."

instance_text.source: The line which represents the indoor swimming pool remains fairly steady, from approximately 1800 to 2500, the period of every year from April to June and October to December own the highest outstanding achievement, whilst the sales are downwards overall.
instance_text.corrected: The line which represents the indoor swimming pool remains fairly steady, from approximately 1800 to 2500, the period of every year from April to June and October to December has the highest outstanding achievement, whilst the sales are downwards overall.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Owns" is for when a person has something like property. It does not seem natural here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Try another word, such as "has."

instance_text.source: clothes trends changes very quickly.
instance_text.corrected: clothes trends change very quickly.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Your subject and verb do not agree in number. "Clothes trends" is plural, but "changes" is only used with a singular subject.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "changes" to a form that goes with a plural subject.

instance_text.source: Then we return to Toluca to continue with my boring life.
instance_text.corrected: Then we returned to Toluca to continue with my boring life.

instance_text.source: In their quest for the perfect seed, genetic engineers have strengthened crops that are destroying the seeds [NONE] biodiversity, as stand by research led by Greenpeace, GMC crops are threatening to human health because they present more toxic traces than non - modified crops.
instance_text.corrected: In their quest for the perfect seed, genetic engineers have strengthened crops that are destroying the seeds ' biodiversity, as stand by research led by Greenpeace, GMC crops are threatening to human health because they present more toxic traces than non - modified crops.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When something belongs to something else, it is necessary to use a possessive.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "seeds" to a possessive form to show what the biodiversity belongs to.

instance_text.source: Although now she is sure, she has suffered a lot. 'The cold' and 'the fear' was inside her.
instance_text.corrected: Although now she is sure, she has suffered a lot. 'The cold' and 'the fear' were inside her.

instance_text.source: Taichung have plenty of trees in the park.

instance_text.source: In purpose to build more necessary networks of housing and transport, areas of farmland, forest and wetland have to be destroyed by many countries today.

instance_text.corrected: Nowadays, every child can get more and more resources from their parents because of less competition with other children.

instance_text.source: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door is opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but ran out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.
instance_text.corrected: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door was opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but ran out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

feedback.feedback_explanation: To use a passive verb in the past tense, it is necessary to use the pattern "was"/"were" plus the past participle.

instance_text.source: For example, during the semi - final first leg AFF Cup 2014 between Vietnam and Malaysia, the players played quite violent, and the supporters of the two teams were very tense.
instance_text.corrected: For example, during the semi - final first leg AFF Cup 2014 between Vietnam and Malaysia, the players played quite violently, and the supporters of the two teams were very tense.

instance_text.corrected: I think one of my favorite sports of all is athletics. I love it because it is a sport where you prove yourself, you have to be better every day than you were yesterday. It forces you to improve every time. Also, it is an exercise that helps your whole body, especially the legs, because it gives them great strength, but also your hands, because they have to be in constant movement, and all the body in general, because you run and your metabolism is accommodated and helps you to have coordination.

instance_text.source: I think this thriller will get your nerves out of you. The movie reveals many things as it continues. It's actually so good and, for those that are scared of thrillers, this movie is more like suspense and I really think you can enjoy it.

instance_text.source: Thus, the investment in research into the influence of nitrate supplementation should continue, the aim of which would be to improve sports performance and improved quality of life.
instance_text.corrected: Thus, the investment in research into the influence of nitrate supplementation should continue, the aim of which would be to improve sports performance and improve quality of life.

instance_text.source: I have got one own camera. It's a Canon.

instance_text.source: . You can experience 19th century Korean imperial architecture and Korean traditional custom.

instance_text.source: In important meetings like the UN General Assembly or G77, many leaders of power countries raise environmental problems as the most concerning problem in their internal policies.

feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "power" to an adjective like "powerful."

instance_text.source: In conclusion, each problem must be solved concerning societal and environmental issues that impede a further progress of our civilization.
instance_text.corrected: In conclusion, each problem must be solved concerning societal and environmental issues that impede the further progress of our civilization.

instance_text.source: However, travelling by bus or tram never get away from our daily routine. Travelling by bus is not as convenient as getting in a car, but you can never know what might happen with your car, where it might get stuck in traffic or some other accident will happen.
instance_text.corrected: However, travelling by bus or tram never get away from our daily routine. Travelling by bus is not as convenient as getting in a car, but you can never know what might happen with your car, where it might get stuck in traffic or some other accident might happen.

instance_text.source: In my opinion, public transport has been improved over the last years, because cities have been putting a lot of investment into that.

instance_text.source: I think that for people who want learning English Write and Improve is great!
instance_text.corrected: I think that for people who want to learn English Write and Improve is great!

instance_text.source: So we can started from the beginning: first, was breakfast, which included some cereals with hot milk.
instance_text.corrected: So we can start from the beginning: first, was breakfast, which included some cereals with hot milk.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Modals like "should," "can," "must," and "might" always use the base form of the verb, not the -ing form.

instance_text.source: Years ago, we used to get through to other people by ringing them up or texting messages by our mobile phone and, as time goes by, nowadays we also can communicate via social networks such as Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp... First of all, we use them to catch up on news and social issues via Twitter instead of newspapers, for instance. It's common to see people having breakfast in a cafeteria readings the news on their smartphone, an image so far from years back.
instance_text.corrected: Years ago, we used to get through to other people by ringing them up or texting messages via our mobile phone and, as time goes by, nowadays we also can communicate via social networks such as Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp... First of all, we use them to catch up on news and social issues via Twitter instead of newspapers, for instance. It's common to see people having breakfast in a cafeteria readings the news on their smartphone, an image so far from years back.

instance_text.source: Except for [NONE] the big cities, public transport is not an easy way to get around the city. That means that in the future even more people will stop using it.

instance_text.source: It means that more kinds of species are endangered because they are unable to adapt themselves to the remaining lands.
instance_text.corrected: It means that more kinds of species are endangered because they are unable to adapt themselves to the remaining land.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The word "land" is generally non-countable. It is mostly used in its plural form when referring to various types or areas of land.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "land" to its singular form.

instance_text.source: We have to preserve the ethical value of maintenance at the same time as we help the next generations to succeed by their own means.
instance_text.corrected: We have to preserve the ethical value of maintenance at the same time as we help the next generation to succeed by their own means.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Ten year ago, the local governing body of the city decided to plant more tree and it asked advice from the citizens of the city about the proposal.
instance_text.corrected: Ten year ago, the local governing body of the city decided to plant more trees and it asked advice from the citizens of the city about the proposal.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the plural form when referring to more than one of an object.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "tree" to be plural.

instance_text.source: So I have had a lot [NONE] problems:
instance_text.corrected: So I have had a lot of problems:

feedback.feedback_explanation: "A lot of" is used with a noun to mean "many" of the given noun.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add the word "of" after the word "lot."

instance_text.source: While we are there, we not only want to see the many attractions in the city, but we would like to visit some of the beautiful places nearby [NONE], so we are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, in the city centre, with good transport links.
instance_text.corrected: While we are there, we not only want to see the many attractions in the city, but we would like to visit some of the beautiful places nearby too, so we are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, in the city centre, with good transport links.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Every morning, some people come the to park and clean. [NONE] That makes us feel really grateful.
instance_text.corrected: Every morning, some people come the to park and clean. up That makes us feel really grateful.

report: The “correction“ is invalid or results in an error.

instance_text.source: More accurate surgery, emotional bond and an increase in communication are examples of positive consequences.
instance_text.corrected: More accurate surgery, emotional bonding and an increase in communication are examples of positive consequences.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Emotional bond" is not quite correct here. It means a specific connection that has already been made.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Try changing this to "emotional bonding," which means the process of making emotional bonds.

instance_text.source: Sukh was so angry with him because he hurt her a lot. Sukh refused to give him her laptop and her brother start fighting with her again and he even slapped his sister.
instance_text.corrected: Sukh was so angry with him because he hurt her a lot. Sukh refused to give him her laptop and her brother started fighting with her again and he even slapped his sister.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the past tense to refer to actions in the past.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Use the past tense form of "start."

instance_text.source: Some people from the area where I live used to feed the birds, but others don't even care.
instance_text.corrected: Some people from the area where I live usually feed the birds, but others don't even care.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: To sum up, it is vital that, nowadays, we think of our future.
instance_text.corrected: To sum up, it is vital that, nowadays, we think about our future.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: We depend on cars so much, as if they are our spare pair of foot.
instance_text.corrected: We depend on cars so much, as if they are our spare pair of feet.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Pair" means that there are two of something, so "foot" can not be singular here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "foot" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: Since that time, we have been very linked until now.
instance_text.corrected: Since that time, we have been very close until now.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Linked" cannot be used for a bond between humans.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Use "close" instead of "linked."

instance_text.source: For example, now high - heeled shoes are very trendy but they cost a lot and most women don't look good in it.
instance_text.corrected: For example, now high - heeled shoes are very trendy but they cost a lot and most women don't look good in them.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The pronoun "it" refers to "shoes," so it should be a plural pronoun.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "it" to be plural.

instance_text.source: Series can also help you to study. For me, it helped me a lot because I love series and some q I watch [NONE] helped me in school, such as Breaking Bad, which helped me in chemistry, and so many others.
instance_text.corrected: Series can also help you to study. For me, it helped me a lot because I love series and some q I watch have helped me in school, such as Breaking Bad, which helped me in chemistry, and so many others.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When describing experiences or whether something ever happened, use the present perfect tense.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the verb form to have/has + past participle of the verb.

instance_text.source: You ca n't miss the stylish cafe in the museum.
instance_text.corrected: You should n't miss the stylish cafe in the museum.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: With a car, I feel more free as I don't depend on other people to get to the site.
instance_text.corrected: With a car, I feel more free as I don't depend on other people to get to the destination.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: Micheal is a clever, shy guy who decided to look for new opportunities outside of his small town. After the tragedy of losing his father, he felt the need to move forward with his life and discover his real needs. No one in Micheal's school was able to understand this weird, isolated guy, so he never accepted having new friendships out of his class, that ends when the class ends. Then there was that girl. A beautiful popular blonde who was in the cheer leaders and every boy [NONE] dreams. One day, after a physics exam, she just stumbled into his bag and knocked his books out of it. 'Sorry', she said, with a sad sexy look!,
instance_text.corrected: Micheal is a clever, shy guy who decided to look for new opportunities outside of his small town. After the tragedy of losing his father, he felt the need to move forward with his life and discover his real needs. No one in Micheal's school was able to understand this weird, isolated guy, so he never accepted having new friendships out of his class, that ends when the class ends. Then there was that girl. A beautiful popular blonde who was in the cheer leaders and every boy 's dreams. One day, after a physics exam, she just stumbled into his bag and knocked his books out of it. 'Sorry', she said, with a sad sexy look!,

feedback.feedback_explanation: When something belongs to something else, it is necessary to use a possessive.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "boy" to its possessive form.

instance_text.source: A couple of years ago, I spent a couple [NONE] weeks in Bright with Ef.
instance_text.corrected: A couple of years ago, I spent a couple of weeks in Bright with Ef.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Though the phrase "a couple <time period>s" can be used casually, in formal registers, such as writing, "a couple of <time period>s" is preferred.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add the word "of" between "couple" and "weeks."

instance_text.source: Every human being has a need in socialising and that is the first reason why I believe we start making friends.
instance_text.corrected: Every human being has a need for socialising and that is the first reason why I believe we start making friends.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "A need" can't be followed by "in" like this.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "in" to "for" to fix this expression.

instance_text.source: Talking about your new job, I was searching for some vacancies. However, they required a full - time worker, so I am going to continue searching for some jobs of part - time.
instance_text.corrected: Talking about your new job, I was searching for some vacancies. However, they required a full - time worker, so I am going to continue searching for some part - time jobs.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Jobs of part-time" is not the right way to express this.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "jobs of part-time" to "part-time jobs."

instance_text.source: Our budget is fixed for only 75 people, it is almost twice the number of participants last year.
instance_text.corrected: Our budget is fixed for only 75 people, which is almost twice the number of participants last year.

feedback.feedback_explanation: This is a relative clause to explain more about something. You can't use "it" here - a relative pronoun is needed instead.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "it" to a relative pronoun.

instance_text.source: Finally, the kind of life that we will see in fifty years from now will have a lot of stuff to help people to have a more comfortable, easier and faster way of life, but this will be only to make more money and consume more and more. Also, things will be faster of waste to make people to change their possessions more often and stimulate consumerism.
instance_text.corrected: Finally, the kind of life that we will see in fifty years from now will have a lot of stuff to help people to have a more comfortable, easier and faster way of life, but this will be only to make more money and consume more and more. Also, things will be faster of waste to make people [NONE] change their possessions more often and stimulate consumerism.

feedback.feedback_explanation: In causative constructions, use the base form of the verb whose action is being caused.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Remove the word "to" to create a base verb form instead of a to-infinitive.

instance_text.source: The person do not need to save large amounts of money to buy a car.
instance_text.corrected: People do not need to save large amounts of money to buy a car.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "The person" is singular, but you are talking about a general case.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Remove the definite article "the" and change the word "person" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door was opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but run out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.
instance_text.corrected: Michael went into the teacher's office, but he found that his teacher wasn't there. Maybe the teacher had gone to the bathroom. Suddenly, the door was opened by a teacher, a teacher who was wearing a bikini came into sight. This incident came as quite a surprise to Michael. She flirted with Michael. Michael felt excited but ran out of the office, but he regretted his action. Michael closed the door and knew at that moment he had made a mistake.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the simple past tense to talk about an event in the past.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "run" to its past tense form.

instance_text.source: Although many people believe that our lives are getting better than they were 20 years ago, scientists have proved that, if we carry on with our ways of living, using, for instance, modern technology, we will lose control of our lives.
instance_text.corrected: Although many people believe that our lives are getting better than they were 20 years ago, scientists have proved that, if we carry on with our way of living, using, for instance, modern technology, we will lose control of our lives.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: In other ways I'll talk about Benzema. He is my friend for many years, but I'm not sure if he is with me or with the others guys, so I want to listen to their version of the story so he is here to talk about that.
instance_text.corrected: In other ways I'll talk about Benzema. He has been my friend for many years, but I'm not sure if he is with me or with the others guys, so I want to listen to their version of the story so he is here to talk about that.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When you talk about something that started in the past and continues until now, it is necessary to use the present perfect tense.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "is" to its present perfect form.

instance_text.source: So, I'm really thinking [NONE] leaving this sport.
instance_text.corrected: So, I'm really thinking about leaving this sport.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When referring to the object of thought, the verb "thinking" requires a preposition to connect to it.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add the word "about" or "of" after the word "thinking."

instance_text.source: However, learning ideas and concepts needs more investigation and understanding [NONE] many of the academic textbooks.
instance_text.corrected: However, learning ideas and concepts needs more investigation and understanding from many of the academic textbooks.

feedback.feedback_explanation: A preposition is required to show the relationship between "understanding" and "many of the academic textbooks."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Consider adding "from" between the words "understanding" and "many."

instance_text.source: Adam was twelve years old, a clever boy in his school, always got the top marks and participate in most activities, and known to all the teachers and students.
instance_text.corrected: Adam was twelve years old, a clever boy in his school, always got the top marks and participated in most activities, and known to all the teachers and students.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the simple past to refer to an action that happened in the past.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "participate" to its simple past tense form.

instance_text.source: The school government should offer more extra - curricular activities, including organising excursions in the local area and giving students a chance to choose the school course which appeals to them the most.
instance_text.corrected: The school governors should offer more extra - curricular activities, including organising excursions in the local area and giving students a chance to choose the school course which appeals to them the most.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Also, it was the governors ' ultimate purpose.
instance_text.corrected: Also, it was the governor 's ultimate purpose.

feedback.feedback_explanation: To create the possessive form for a singular noun, use "'s." Do not put the apostrophe outside of the "s" unless the word is plural.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "governors'" to "governor's."

instance_text.source: She was so excited and happy. She didn't know what she could write to her lover, she realised that he was alive so she just wrote 'Dear, please take care of yourself, we will be here waiting for you. I'm pregnant, it's a boy. If you let me choose, his name will be Taylor as was your fathers ' name. I have always loved you and I always will. Do your best, come back as soon as you can, because I need you, love Alison'.
instance_text.corrected: She was so excited and happy. She didn't know what she could write to her lover, she realised that he was alive so she just wrote 'Dear, please take care of yourself, we will be here waiting for you. I'm pregnant, it's a boy. If you let me choose, his name will be Taylor as was your father 's name. I have always loved you and I always will. Do your best, come back as soon as you can, because I need you, love Alison'.

feedback.feedback_explanation: The possessive form "s'" is only used when the word is plural.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Move the apostrophe before the s to fix this possessive.

instance_text.source: Now our company is going to do multidimensional operations, not just focus on furniture, but also on home appliance.
instance_text.corrected: Now our company is going to do multidimensional operations, not just focus on furniture, but also on home appliances.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Appliance" is a countable noun and can not be used in the singular when speaking in general terms.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "appliance" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: When you have finished your studies and you have gotten a job where where you do the same activities every day, the brain doesn't work hard and you might have some problems like forgetting words, dates, information that you had learned a few years ago, because your memory won't work in the same way.
instance_text.corrected: When you have finished your studies and you have gotten a job where where you do the same activities every day, the brain doesn't work hard and you might have some problems like forgetting words, dates, information that you learnt a few years ago, because your memory won't work in the same way.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: He thought I should perform a show jumping over several wrecked cars, but it was too risky because he had not had any experience of that kind of show.
instance_text.corrected: He thought he should perform a show jumping over several wrecked cars, but it was too risky because he had not had any experience of that kind of show.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: They learn and understand very good English.
instance_text.corrected: They learn and understand English very well.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Good" is an adjective, but it is modifying the verb "understand." An adverb is needed instead.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Replace "good" with "well" and move the adverb phrase to the end of the sentence.

instance_text.source: Public transport means travelling around the world and cities using trains, buses, taxi, airplanes etc.
instance_text.corrected: Public transport means travelling around the world and cities using trains, buses, taxis, airplanes etc.

feedback.feedback_explanation: Use the plural form of the word when talking about the word in general.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "taxi" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: It is one of the [NONE] exercises for anybody who wants to get thin.
instance_text.corrected: It is one of the best exercises for anybody who wants to get thin.

report: Both grammatically valid; more context is necessary.

instance_text.source: Suddenly, a giant fish fell from the sky, causing him [NONE] spit out the hairball. Jack could not believe what he saw. The man riding the fish was Bugs Bunny!
instance_text.corrected: Suddenly, a giant fish fell from the sky, causing him to spit out the hairball. Jack could not believe what he saw. The man riding the fish was Bugs Bunny!

feedback.feedback_explanation: When creating a causative construction, the infinitive form ("to" and the simple present form of the verb) is required after the direct object.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "spit" into a to-infinitive to complete this causative.

instance_text.source: I have other qualities like, cooking like a super chef or even better than that. I am the most organized person in this country, and I love to work with children because it is a way to teach everything you know to other people and help [NONE] to improve as a person.
instance_text.corrected: I have other qualities like, cooking like a super chef or even better than that. I am the most organized person in this country, and I love to work with children because it is a way to teach everything you know to other people and help them to improve as a person.

feedback.feedback_explanation: You are using a causative construction that takes the pattern "help" + (person) + (action), but you are missing the (person) part here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Add a noun or pronoun after "help" to complete this causative.

instance_text.source: We tried to gave her help but she was so heavy and we could not do that. Then we tried to find help,
instance_text.corrected: We tried to give her help but she was so heavy and we could not do that. Then we tried to find help,

feedback.feedback_explanation: Infinitives are made with the word "to" and the base form of the verb.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change the word "gave" to the base form.

instance_text.source: Anyway, those tribes would not even need or want an education or a world language because it is their way of life to live in groups together with the nature and disturbing these cultural groups would simply be unnecessary.
instance_text.corrected: Anyway, those tribes would not even need or want an education or a world language because it is their way of life to live in groups together with [NONE] nature and disturbing these cultural groups would simply be unnecessary.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Nature" is an abstract noun, so it does not need an article here.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Remove the article "the."

instance_text.source: For instance, filling the fridge with a great amount of fresh fruit and vegetables, doing some exercise and having some fun with friends regularly.
instance_text.corrected: For instance, filling the fridge with a large amount of fresh fruit and vegetables, doing some exercise and having some fun with friends regularly.

report: The “error“ is acceptable; correction not necessary.

instance_text.source: Nowadays, every child can get more and more resources from their parents because of less competition with other child.
instance_text.corrected: Nowadays, every child can get more and more resources from their parents because of less competition with other children.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Child" is singular here, but you seem to be talking about more than one.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "child" to its plural form.

instance_text.source: The most important step is inspect the notes to see which are good quality sheets and which are bad sheets.
instance_text.corrected: The most important step is inspecting the notes to see which are good quality sheets and which are bad sheets.

feedback.feedback_explanation: "Inspect" is a verb, so it must be changed to a noun form to be used in this situation.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "inspect" to the gerund form (-ing).

instance_text.source: There are a lot of high - rise buildings and it causes flooding along the high - rise building 's section.
instance_text.corrected: There are a lot of high - rise buildings and it causes flooding along the high - rise buildings ' section.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When referring to the possessive objects of plural words, put the possessive apostrophe after the "s."
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "building's" to "buildings'."

instance_text.source: That is why I totally agree with Richardson's modality dealing with this important issue which is present in students', schools' and parents [NONE] lives nowadays.
instance_text.corrected: That is why I totally agree with Richardson's modality dealing with this important issue which is present in students', schools' and parents ' lives nowadays.

feedback.feedback_explanation: When something belongs to someone, it is necessary to use a possessive.
feedback.feedback_suggestion: Change "parents" to a possessive form to show whose lives we are talking about.
